org.forgerock.openam.audit

Class AuditEventFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.audit.AuditEventFactory

  • @Singleton
public class AuditEventFactory
extends Object
    Factory for creation of AuditEvent builders. Facilitates mocking of event builders.
    Since:
    13.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AuditEventFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AMAccessAuditEventBuilder accessEvent(String realm)
      Creates a new AMAccessAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event.
      AMActivityAuditEventBuilder activityEvent(String realm)
      Creates a new AMActivityAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event.
      AMAuthenticationAuditEventBuilder authenticationEvent(String realm)
      Creates a new AMAuthenticationAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event.
      AMConfigAuditEventBuilder configEvent(String realm)
      Creates a new AMConfigAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuditEventFactory

        public AuditEventFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • accessEvent

        public AMAccessAuditEventBuilder accessEvent(String realm)
        Creates a new AMAccessAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event. If the realm is either null or empty it will not be added to the event. Note that we deliberately do not provide a convenience method with no realm to force implementers to consider providing the realm. We must publish per realm wherever applicable.
        Parameters:
        realm - The realm in which the audit event occurred, or null if realm is not applicable.
        Returns:
        AMAccessAuditEventBuilder

      • activityEvent

        public AMActivityAuditEventBuilder activityEvent(String realm)
        Creates a new AMActivityAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event. If the realm is either null or empty it will not be added to the event. Note that we deliberately do not provide a convenience method with no realm to force implementers to consider providing the realm. We must publish per realm wherever applicable.
        Parameters:
        realm - The realm in which the audit event occurred, or null if realm is not applicable.
        Returns:
        AMActivityAuditEventBuilder

      • configEvent

        public AMConfigAuditEventBuilder configEvent(String realm)
        Creates a new AMConfigAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event. If the realm is either null or empty it will not be added to the event. Note that we deliberately do not provide a convenience method with no realm to force implementers to consider providing the realm. We must publish per realm wherever applicable.
        Parameters:
        realm - The realm in which the audit event occurred, or null if realm is not applicable.
        Returns:
        AMConfigAuditEventBuilder

      • authenticationEvent

        public AMAuthenticationAuditEventBuilder authenticationEvent(String realm)
        Creates a new AMAuthenticationAuditEventBuilder for the specified realm and adds the realm to the event. If the realm is either null or empty it will not be added to the event. Note that we deliberately do not provide a convenience method with no realm to force implementers to consider providing the realm. We must publish per realm wherever applicable.
        Parameters:
        realm - The realm in which the audit event occurred, or null if realm is not applicable.
        Returns:
